index.description: Returns a unitized value for each specifed component of a mesh, vertex, face center, or edge midpoint based on its distance to the closest sample index point relative to the furthest point from all sample points. This value is remapped to a user specified domain.

index.name: Valence
index.summary: Returns the valence or number of connected vertices to a given vertex.

index.name: Vertex Face Angles
index.summary: Returns the angle at each vertex normal of a mesh tested against the connected vertex normals.

index.name: Vertex Normal Direction
index.summary: Returns the angle at each vertex normal of a mesh tested against a vector.

index.name: Explode Unwelded
index.summary:
Implements Explode Unwelded.
"Explode the mesh into submeshes where a submesh is a collection of faces that are contained within a closed loop of "unwelded" edges."

index.name: Mesh Caps
index.summary: Caps all naked edges in a mesh by introducing a new point at the averaged volumetric center fanning about it.

index.name: Mesh Explode
index.summary: Explodes each face of a mesh into a new single faced mesh which maintains vertex colors and whose normals can either be rebuilt or retain the existing vertex normals.

index.name: Mesh Extend
index.summary: Extends all naked edges of a mesh by a given distance by adding a new row of mesh faces

index.name: Mesh Offset & Extrude
index.summary: Takes a mesh and offsets along each vertex normal or aligned with input vectors with independent options for closing the top, bottom and edges as well as offseting in both directions.

index.name: Offset Edges
index.summary: Takes edge of a mesh and offsets it along the vertex normal or extrudes along a input vector. Output can be toggled between a single mesh or individual meshes per face.

index.name: Span & Bridge
index.summary: Removes multiple pairs of mesh faces at given indices from either one or two meshes and bridges the resulting naked edges
index.description: Removes multiple pairs of mesh faces at given indices from either one or two meshes and bridges the resulting naked edges. An optional sorting boolean attempts to organize the vertexes to avoid torsion in the bridging

index.name: Unweld & Explode
index.summary: Unwelds a mesh at the user specified angle and explodes it into new meshes at unwelded edges.

index.name: Antisnub
index.summary: Creates an advanced face effect by creating the antiprism extrusion from each face and snubbing the top corner vertex of each new face on each face of the original mesh outwards along the direction of the face normal
index.description: Creates an advanced face effect by creating the antiprism extrusion from each face and snubbing the top corner vertex of each new face on each face of the original mesh outwards along the direction of the face normal. All (c,s,d,t) values corespond to the input meshes face sequence and can recieve either a single value are a corresponding list of values.

index.name: Hair
index.summary: Creates an advanced hair effect from a tapered extrusion which can rotate within a pore relief on each face of the mesh outwards along the direction of the face normal
index.description: Creates an advanced hair effect from a tapered extrusion which can rotate within a pore relief on each face of the mesh outwards along the direction of the face normal. All (c,s,d,t) values corespond to the input meshes face sequence and can recieve either a single value are a corresponding list of values.

index.name: Node
index.summary: Creates an advanced face effect stellating the face and creating an optional directional pore from each new face on each face of the original mesh outwards along the direction of the face normal
index.description: Creates an advanced face effect stellating the face and creating an optional directional pore from each new face on each face of the original mesh outwards along the direction of the face normal. All (c,s,d,t) values corespond to the input meshes face sequence and can recieve either a single value are a corresponding list of values.

index.name: Peel
index.summary: Creates an advanced peeling effect rotating subdivided faes outwards about each edge of each face of the mesh outwards along the direction of the face normal
index.description: Creates an advanced peeling effect rotating subdivided faes outwards about each edge of each face of the mesh outwards along the direction of the face normal. All (c,s,d,t) values corespond to the input meshes face sequence and can recieve either a single value are a corresponding list of values.

index.name: Pinch
index.summary: Creates an advanced pinching moving points at the vertex and edge centers independently towards the center of each face of the mesh outwards along the direction of the face normal
index.description: Creates an advanced pinching moving points at the vertex and edge centers independently towards the center of each face of the mesh outwards along the direction of the face normal. All (c,s,d,t) values corespond to the input meshes face sequence and can recieve either a single value are a corresponding list of values.

index.name: Polyp
index.summary: Creates an advanced polyp effect from the edge of each face of the mesh outwards along the direction of the face normal
index.description: Creates an advanced polyp effect from the edge of each face of the mesh outwards along the direction of the face normal. All (c,s,d,t) values corespond to the input meshes face sequence and can recieve either a single value are a corresponding list of values.

index.name: Pore
index.summary: Creates a pore effect with a flat edge and raised facet on each face of the mesh outwards along the direction of the face normal
index.description: Creates a pore effect with a flat edge and raised facet on each face of the mesh outwards along the direction of the face normal. All (c,s,d,t) values corespond to the input meshes face sequence and can recieve either a single value are a corresponding list of values.

index.name: Branch
index.summary: Recursively branches each mesh face which is parallel to the original mesh faces into a set of new subdivided quad extrusions.

index.name: Crumple
index.summary: Recursively stellates each mesh face into a new mesh offset along the face normal.

index.name: Crystalize
index.summary: Recursively decomposes each mesh face into a new truncated open mesh pyramid offset along the face normal

index.name: Expand
index.summary: Recursively decomposes each mesh face into a new mesh offset along the face normal connected only by the corner vertices.

index.name: Facet
index.summary: Recursively stellates a new face made from the midpoints of the edge lines.

index.name: Cairo Tiling
index.summary: Applies a Mesh to a surface based on the Cairo Tiling tesselation covering its domain, recognizing closure in both the U and V directions when the patterning allows.

index.name: Diamond Tiling
index.summary: Applies a Mesh to a surface based on Diamond Tiling tesselation covering its domain, recognizing closure in both the U and V directions when the patterning allows.

index.name: Elongated Triangle Tiling
index.summary: Applies a Mesh to a surface based on the Elongated Triangle tesselation covering its domain, recognizing closure in both the U and V directions when the patterning allows.

index.name: Fill Mesh Holes
index.summary: Creates a simple fan mesh from an input curve with options for introducing vertex colors

index.name: Mesh Loft
index.summary: Creates a mesh from the control points of input curves with multiple methods for defining topology

index.name: ngon Mesh
index.summary: This experimental component creates a topology map for mesh comprised of faces of with a vertex count of 3 or higher
index.description: This experimental component creates a topology map for mesh comprised of faces of with a vertex count of 3 or higher. This component takes a list of polylines with coincident control points and merges these points into a mesh, creating unified vertices, edge, faces, and normals as well as a map of the topological relationships between the elements.

index.name: Patterned Triangulation
index.summary: Applies a boolean pattern based Triangular Mesh to a surface covering its domain, recognizing closure in both the U and V directions when the patterning allows.

index.name: Regular Triangulation
index.summary: Applies a Regular Triangular Mesh to a surface covering its domain, recognizing closure in both the U and V directions when the patterning allows.

index.name: Rhombitrihexagonal Tiling
index.summary: Applies a Mesh to a surface based on the Rhombitrihexagonal tesselation covering its domain, recognizing closure in both the U and V directions when the patterning allows
index.description: Applies a Mesh to a surface based on the Rhombitrihexagonal tesselation covering its domain, recognizing closure in both the U and V directions when the patterning allows. All non quad faces are triangulated at output.

index.name: Snub Square Tiling
index.summary: Applies a Mesh to a surface based on the Snubbed Square tesselation covering its domain, recognizing closure in both the U and V directions when the patterning allows.

index.name: Truncated Square Tiling
index.summary: Applies a Mesh to a surface based on the Truncated Square tesselation covering its domain, recognizing closure in both the U and V directions when the patterning allows
index.description: Applies a Mesh to a surface based on the Truncated Square tesselation covering its domain, recognizing closure in both the U and V directions when the patterning allows. All non quad faces are triangulated at output.

index.name: Baycentric Mesh Morph
index.summary: Uses Barycentric Mapping to morph meshes from reference boundaries to each face of a target mesh, or pair of meshes with identical topologies.

index.name: Map Curve to Curve
index.summary: Uses Barycentric Mapping to morph curves from a reference boundary polyline to a target polyline of the same topology.

index.name: Map Curves to Mesh
index.summary: Uses Barycentric Mapping to morph curves from reference boundaries to each face of a target mesh, or pair of meshes with identical topologies.

index.name: Map Edge Values
index.summary: Maps and averages unitized values cooresponding to each edge of a mesh to its other constituent elements.

index.name: Map Face Values
index.summary: Maps and averages unitized values cooresponding to each face of a mesh to its other constituent elements.

index.name: Map Mesh to Curves
index.summary: Uses Barycentric Mapping to morph meshes from a reference boundary polyline to a target polyline of the same topology.

index.name: Map Points to Curve
index.summary: Uses Barycentric Mapping to morph points from a reference boundary polyline to a target polyline of the same topology.

index.name: Map Points to Mesh
index.summary: Uses Barycentric Mapping to morph points from reference boundaries to each face of a target mesh, or pair of meshes with identical topologies.

index.name: Map Vertex Values
index.summary: Maps and averages unitized values cooresponding to each vertex of a mesh to its other constituent elements.

index.name: Mesh Twisted Box
index.summary: Creates twisted boxes which either span or project off of quad mesh faces creating 8 points which can be used to define a twisted box
index.description: Creates twisted boxes which either span or project off of quad mesh faces creating 8 points which can be used to define a twisted box. This allows for box morphing to be mapped to meshes, replacing the faces with morphed objects.

index.name: Wrap Data
index.summary: Converts a list of data into an integer indexed dictionary which is wrapped into a single object
index.description:
Converts a list of data into an integer indexed dictionary which is wrapped into a single object.
The component was developed for mapping colors, numbers, and other data to ngon components to simplify the process of data matching.

index.name: Align Mesh Vertices
index.summary: Collapses vertex positions based on their proximity and the sequence in which they are toplogically ordered.

index.name: Calculate Vertex Normals
index.summary: Rebuilds vertex normals with a full range of options.

index.name: Compute Face Normals
index.summary: Rebuilds the Face Normals for a mesh with a full range of options.

index.name: Mirror Face Orientation
index.summary: Mirrors selected face topology.

index.name: Reverse Face Normal
index.summary: Reverses selected face normals

index.name: Shift Face Orientation
index.summary: Shifts selected face topology, similar to rotating the face.

index.name: Triangulate Mesh
index.summary: Triangulates the quad faces of mesh based on natural direction, shortest/ longest length, or greatest or smallest area.

index.name: Face Bands
index.summary: Indexes Mesh Faces based on their topological distance from naked edges or selected points.

index.name: Proximity Vertex Selection
index.summary: Selects vertices based on their closest point distance to sample geometries.

index.name: Select by Topological Distance
index.summary: Returns a series of unitized values per vertex based on their topological edge's cumulative physical distance, divided by a user specified range for selection.

index.name: Select by Vertex Angle
index.summary: Selects vertices based on an angle tolerance, determined by testing the angle between all edges shared by a vertex about a face and sums the value.

index.name: Select Mesh Edge
index.summary: Allows for the selection of Grasshopper or Rhino Mesh Edges. Returning the Indices, Mid Point, and Representational Line at each selection.
index.description:
Allows for the selection of Grasshopper or Rhino Mesh Edges. Returning the Indices, Mid Point, and Representational Line at each selection.
(Note: Grasshopper geometry is made selectable by temporarily baking it to Rhino to acquire the topology information.)

index.name: Select Mesh Faces
index.summary: Allows for the selection of Grasshopper or Rhino Mesh Faces. Returning the Indices, Face Center, Face, and Face Normal at each selection.
index.description:
Allows for the selection of Grasshopper or Rhino Mesh Faces. Returning the Indices, Face Center, Face, and Face Normal at each selection.
(Note: Grasshopper geometry is made selectable by temporarily baking it to Rhino to acquire the topology information.)

index.name: Select Mesh Vertices
index.summary: Allows for the selection of Grasshopper or Rhino Mesh Vertices. Returning the Indices, Point, and Normal at each selection.
index.description:
Allows for the selection of Grasshopper or Rhino Mesh Vertices. Returning the Indices, Point, and Normal at each selection.
(Note: Grasshopper geometry is made selectable by temporarily baking it to Rhino to acquire the topology information.)

index.name: Vertex Rings
index.summary: Indexes Vertices based on their topological distance from naked edges or selected points.

index.name: Highlight
index.summary: Applies a color to all naked edge or non naked vertex points in a mesh

index.name: Label Edge
index.summary: Creates point lists of points at each mesh edge at its midpoint

index.name: Label Face
index.summary: Creates point lists of center points of each mesh face at its center

index.name: Label Topo Vert
index.summary: Creates point lists of the meshes topology vertex points offset on the face to remove overlap

index.name: Label Vertex
index.summary: Creates point lists of the meshes vertex points offset on the face to remove overlap

index.name: Label Vertex Indices
index.summary: Creates point lists of vertex sequence of each face offset on the face to remove overlap

index.name: Catmull Clark nGon Subdivision
index.summary: Applies Catmull Clark Subdivision to a list of closed polylines which are treated as the faces and vertices of a nGon mesh.

index.name: Doo Sabin Subdivision
index.summary: Applies Doo Sabin Subdivision to a list of closed polylines which are treated as the faces and vertices of a nGon mesh.

index.name: Expansion Subdivision
index.summary: Applies Expansion Subdivision to a list of closed polylines which are treated as the faces and vertices of a nGon mesh
index.description: Applies Expansion Subdivision to a list of closed polylines which are treated as the faces and vertices of a nGon mesh. Expansion is similar to the Doo Sabin method, but creates its new vertices at a unitized position between the existing vertex and face center.

index.name: Face Center Subdivision
index.summary: Applies Face Center Subdivision to a list of closed polylines which are treated as the faces and vertices of a nGon mesh.

index.name: Mid Edge Subdivision
index.summary: Applies Mid Edge Subdivision to a list of closed polylines which are treated as the faces and vertices of a nGon mesh.

index.name: Modified Kobbelt Subdivision
index.summary: Applies a modified version of Kobbelt Subdivision which creates new quad faces from a list of closed polylines which are treated as the faces and vertices of a nGon mesh.

index.name: Root 3 Subdivision
index.summary: Applies Root 3 Subdivision to a list of closed polylines which are treated as the faces and vertices of a nGon mesh.

index.name: Weighted Butterfly Subdivision
index.summary: Implements the basic form of Butterfly subdivision which maintains the original meshes vertex locations. This method does requires a closed mesh volume with only triangular faces.

index.name: Weighted Catmull Clark Subdivision
index.summary: Based off of the implementation of Weaverbird's subdivision, this implementation of Catmull Clark Subdivision introduced the option to modify the weight of smoothing or displacement from origin, of the face, edge, and vertex based vertices
index.description: Based off of the implementation of Weaverbird's subdivision, this implementation of Catmull Clark Subdivision introduced the option to modify the weight of smoothing or displacement from origin, of the face, edge, and vertex based vertices.

index.name: Weighted Loop Subdivision
index.summary: Based off of the implementation of Weaverbird's subdivision, this implementation of Loop Subdivision introduced the option to modify the weight of smoothing or displacement from origin, of the edge and vertex based vertices
index.description: Based off of the implementation of Weaverbird's subdivision, this implementation of Loop Subdivision introduced the option to modify the weight of smoothing or displacement from origin, of the edge and vertex based vertices.

index.name: Weighted Root 3 Subdivision
index.summary: An implementation of Root 3 Subdivision, this method follows the model established in weaverbird for resolving edge conditions
index.description: An implementation of Root 3 Subdivision, this method follows the model established in weaverbird for resolving edge conditions. For a correct implementation, mesh faces should be triangular, however the method has been modified to allow for quad faces as well.

index.name: Aperture+0
index.summary: Replaces selected faces of a mesh or the interior of a curve with a frame around the edge by evaluating points from the points along face's edges to its center, creating 0 new points along the edge.

index.name: Aperture+2
index.summary: Replaces selected faces of a mesh or the interior of a curve with a frame around the edge by evaluating points from points along the face's edge to its center, creating 2 new points along the edge and removing the face's vertex
index.description: Replaces selected faces of a mesh or the interior of a curve with a frame around the edge by evaluating points from points along the face's edge to its center, creating 2 new points along the edge and removing the face's vertex.

index.name: Fan+3

index.name: Batwing
index.summary: Creates a volumetric mesh from either a single mesh face and depth or between two parallel meshes of idential construction based on the topology of the Batwing adapted with parametric inputs to the geometric proportions within the bounds of each offset pair of mesh faces
index.description:
Creates a volumetric mesh from either a single mesh face and depth or between two parallel meshes of idential construction based on the topology of the Batwing adapted with parametric inputs to the geometric proportions within the bounds of each offset pair of mesh faces.

index.name: Continuum
index.summary: Creates a series of connections perpendicular and parallel to each meshes face creating a loop from front face to back face. Inspired by the work of Erwin Hauer.
index.description:
Creates a series of connections perpendicular and parallel to each meshes face creating a loop from front face to back face. Inspired by the work of Erwin Hauer.
(Note: Only works with even point counts, for best results adjacent faces should have similar vertex organization)

index.name: Criss Cross
index.summary: Creates a series of connections perpendicular and parallel to each meshes face bridging between every other edge.
index.description:
Creates a series of connections perpendicular and parallel to each meshes face bridging between every other edge.
(Note: Only works with even quad faces and polygons with 4 control points, for best results adjacent faces should have similar vertex organization)

index.name: Link
index.summary: Creates a series of radially arrayed links from each mesh face edge about each face center and back to the same edge

index.name: Net
index.summary: Creates a series of radially arrayed interlocking ribbons from each mesh face edge about each face center

index.description: Construct a Monoceros Explicit Rule (connector-to-connector) from Monoceros Module name and connector number. The existence of the Module and the Connector as well as whether the Connectors are opposite is not being checked. Use Collect Rules component to remove the invalid Rules.

index.name: Construct Explicit Rule between 2 Lists
index.summary: Construct a Monoceros Explicit Rule (connector-to-connector) between all listed Connectors of all listed Modules of two lists
index.description: Construct a Monoceros Explicit Rule (connector-to-connector) between all listed Connectors of all listed Modules of two lists. The existence of the Module and the Connector as well as whether the Connectors are opposite is checked only if the optional list of all Modules is provided. Otherwise use Collect Rules component to remove the invalid Rules.

index.name: Construct Indifferent Rule

index.name: Construct Rule At Boundary

index.name: Construct Typed Rule

index.description: Construct a Monoceros Typed Rule (connector-to-all-same-type-connectors) from Monoceros Module name, Connector index and Connector Type. The existence of the Module and Connector is not being checked. The Connector Type will be converted to lowercase.

index.name: Deconstruct Typed Rule

index.name: Rule at Boundary from Point

index.name: Scan Slots for Rules
index.summary: Scan solved Slots and extract applied Rules.

index.name: Typed Rule from Point

index.name: Unwrap Typed Rules

index.summary: Add one layer of Monoceros Slots around the existing boundaries.

index.name: Set Principle Value
index.summary: Set the principle value of an associative array
index.description:
Set the principle value of an associative array. An assoc will behave like its principal value if the processing component doesn't support associative array.
By default, an assoc will take the first item as its principle value, unless the first item is a String/Text.
If unset and the first item is a String/Text, an assoc will not have a principle value. See example for more information.

index.name: Curve Length At
index.summary: Get the length along a curve from its start to a point on the curve (or optionally to a parameter on the curve), if point is not on the curve it will be pulled to it.

index.name: Curve Length Between
index.summary: Get the lengths along a curve between points on the curve (or optionally parameters on the curve), if points are not on the curve they will be pulled to it.

index.name: Curve Spans
index.summary: Gets the curve sub-domain for each span in a curve and gets information about the spans such as, amount of spans, length of each span, degree of each span, and curve parameters at the span ends.

index.name: Curve Statistics
index.summary: Get statistics about a curve such as control point count, edit point count, kink point count, segment count, span count, and knot vector count.

index.name: Discrete Polyline
index.summary: Create a polyline made of target vector oriented segments by finding the closest target vector by angle to each vector between the reference vertices.

index.summary: Search a curve for segments at specified degrees and fit new curve segments through them to a specified degree, without changing the general shape.

index.summary: Fit a new curve through an existing curve with kink angle smoothing, without changing the general shape.

index.summary: Test if a curve is an arc, circle, or ellipse as defined by Rhino. Curves can be multiple types.

index.summary: Test if a curve has kinks, and gets information about the kinks such as, amount of kinks and the length along curve where each kink exists.

index.name: Is Curve Linear

index.name: Is Curve Segmented
index.summary: Test if a curve has segments, and gets information about the segments such as, amount of segments, length of each segment, and degree of each segment.

index.summary: Append a set of polysurfaces (Breps) which are disjoint to become a single polysurface (Brep) even though they are not touching or joined. Can also append surfaces.

index.name: Automatic Edge Surface
index.summary: Create a surface between 2, 3, or 4 auto sorted edge curves.

index.name: Automatic Network Surface
index.summary: Create a surface from an auto sorted curve network.

index.name: Average Surface
index.summary: Solve the arithmetic average for a set of surfaces, trimmed surfaces will be treated as untrimmed.

index.name: Constrained Volume Box
index.summary: Create a rectangular or regular box the size of a specified volume with {x}, {y}, and {z} proportion factors, centered on a plane.

index.name: Constrained Volume Ellipsoid
index.summary: Create an ellipsoid or sphere the size of a specified volume with {x}, {y}, and {z} proportion factors, centered on a plane.

index.name: Extrude Tapered Polysurface
index.summary: Extrude a profile with a taper from draft angle.

index.name: Fit Surface
index.summary: Fit a new surface through an existing surface when possible without changing the general shape, also works with trimmed surfaces.

index.name: Flip Polysurface
index.summary: Flip the normals of a polysurface (Brep), closed polysurfaces (Breps) cannot be flipped and will output with no change.

index.name: Is Polysurface Closed
index.summary: Test if a polysurface (Brep) is closed.

index.name: Is Surface Closed
index.summary: Test if a surface is closed and if its edges are closed in the {u} or {v} directions.

index.name: Is Surface Collapsed
index.summary: Test if a surface has edges collapsed to a point (singularities).

index.name: Is Surface Trimmed
index.summary: Test if a surface is trimmed, can also test a polysurface (Brep) for trimmed faces.

index.name: Mesh To Polysurface
index.summary: Convert a mesh into a nurbs polysurface (Brep).

index.name: Mirror Cut Polysurface
index.summary: Cut a polysurface(Brep) with a plane, mirror the kept side of the cut across a mirror plane, and combine it with the kept side. Can also mirror cut surfaces.

index.name: Mirror Cut Surface
index.summary: Cut a surface with a plane, mirror the kept side of the cut across a mirror plane, and combine it with the kept side (for trimmed surfaces use Mirror Cut Polysurface).

index.name: Offset Surface
index.summary: Offset a surface with the option of offsetting both sides at different distances and creating a solid, also works with trimmed surfaces and polysurface (Brep) faces as separated offsets.

index.name: Parameter Subdivide Surface
index.summary: Generate a grid of subdivision surfaces on a surface from domain dividing {u} and {v} parameters.

index.name: Plane Trim Surface
index.summary: Trim (remove) the parts of a surface on one side of a plane, also works with trimmed surfaces and polysurfaces (Breps).

index.name: Rebuild Surface
index.summary: Rebuild a surface to a given point count, degree, and domain in the {u} and {v} directions, also works with trimmed surfaces.

index.name: Remap Surface Domain²
index.summary: Remap a surfaces {uv} domain² range to an input domain² range with the option of matching the {uv} domain² range of a guide surface, also works with trimmed surfaces.

index.name: Reparameterize Surface
index.summary: Reparameterize a surface to have a (uv) domain² range from 0 to 1, also works with trimmed surfaces.

index.name: Shell Polysurface
index.summary: Creates a hallowed out thickened shell from a closed polysurface (Brep).

index.name: Shrink Trimmed Surface
index.summary: Shrinks the underlying untrimmed surface of a trimmed surface to be as close as possible to the trimmed surface edges, can also shrink trimmed polysurface (Brep) faces.

index.name: Split Kinky Surface
index.summary: Split the output surface from an unsplit surface component into a polysurface(Brep) if it has kinks, if surface has no kinks it will output with no change.

index.name: Superimpose Surface
index.summary: Superimpose the {uv} control point count, {uv} degree, {uv} domain, and trims of a reference surface onto a target surface, also works with trimmed surfaces.

index.name: Surface Degree
index.summary: Get the degree value of a surface for its {u} and {v} directions.

index.name: Surface Spans
index.summary: Gets the surface sub-domain²s for each span in a surface and gets information about the spans such as, sub-domains of each span, amount of spans in each direction, lengths of each span, degrees of each span, isocurve span parameters, and surface parameter coordinates at the span ends
index.description: Gets the surface sub-domain²s for each span in a surface and gets information about the spans such as, sub-domains of each span, amount of spans in each direction, lengths of each span, degrees of each span, isocurve span parameters, and surface parameter coordinates at the span ends.

index.name: Surface Statistics
index.summary: Get statistics about a surface or polysurface (Brep) such as face count, untrimmed face count, trimmed face count, edge count, vertex count, and countrol point count.

index.name: Swap Surface Directions
index.summary: Swap or reverse the {u} and {v} directions of a surface, also works with trimmed surfaces but trims will swap as well.

index.name: Tween Consecutive Surfaces
index.summary: Tween consecutively between a set of surfaces, trimmed surfaces will be treated as untrimmed.

index.name: Tween Through Surfaces
index.summary: Tween through a set of surfaces, trimmed surfaces will be treated as untrimmed.

index.name: Tween Two Surfaces
index.summary: Tween between two surfaces, trimmed surfaces will be treated as untrimmed.

index.name: Tween Two Surfaces Along Curve
index.summary: Tween between two surfaces along a guide curve (or optionally along two guide curves), trimmed surfaces will be treated as untrimmed.

index.name: Unroll Polysurface
index.summary: Unroll a polysurface (Brep) so its faces lay flat on a plane, with the options to unroll points and curves along with the polysurface (Brep) faces. Can also unroll surfaces.

index.name: Unsplit Edge Surface
index.summary: Create an untrimmed edge surface between 2, 3, or 4 edge curves which doesn't split into a polysurface(Brep) at kinks.

index.name: Unsplit Extrude Surface
index.summary: Create an untrimmed extruded surface from a profile curve or surface along a vector, curve, or to a point, which doesn't split into a polysurface(Brep) at kinks.

index.name: Unsplit Loft Surface
index.summary: Create an untrimmed lofted surface through a set of section curves or surfaces which doesn't split into a polysurface(Brep) at kinks.

index.name: Unsplit Rail Revolve Surface
index.summary: Create an untrimmed revolved surface from a profile curve or surface guided by a rail curve around an axis line which doesn't split into a polysurface(Brep) at kinks.

index.name: Unsplit Revolve Surface
index.summary: Create an untrimmed revolved surface from a profile curve or surface around an axis line which doesn't split into a polysurface(Brep) at kinks.

index.name: Unsplit Sum Surface
index.summary: Create an untrimmed sum surface from two edge curves which doesn't split into a polysurface(Brep) at kinks.

index.name: Unsplit Sweep Surface
index.summary: Create an untrimmed swept surface through a set of section curves or surfaces along a rail curve (or optionally along two rail curves) which doesn't split into a polysurface(Brep) at kinks.

index.name: Weighted Average Surface
index.summary: Solve the arithmetic weighted average for a set of surfaces, trimmed surfaces will be treated as untrimmed.

index.name: Average Transform
index.summary: Solve the arithmetic average for a set of transforms.

index.name: Mass Transform
index.summary: Create a single mass transform by compounding a set of transforms, like Grasshopper's Compound component but with access to partial results (each step of the mass transformation).

index.name: Mirror Combine Transforms
index.summary: Mirror a set of transforms across its end or start and combine it with the original set.

index.name: Mirror Cut Transforms
index.summary: Cut a set of transforms at an index, mirror the kept side of the cut across the index, and combine it with the kept side.

index.name: Morph To Twisted Box
index.summary:
Morph geometries from reference boxes to target twisted boxes.

(*Rhino 6 only, for Rhino 5 use Grasshopper's Box Morph component.)

[Multi-Threaded]

index.name: Move To Point
index.summary: Move (translate) an object from one point to another.

index.name: Recursive Transform
index.summary: Recursively transform geometry to get a self-referential step sequence of transformed geometry.

index.name: Rotate Euler
index.summary: Rotate an object by three plane axes and three angles in degrees, each axis derived from the plane previous.

index.name: Rotate Quaternion
index.summary: Rotate an object from one plane to another by a rotation factor, derived from quaternion rotation.

index.name: Rotate World
index.summary: Rotate an object by three plane axes and three angles in degrees, each axis derived from the initial base planes world.

index.name: Scale To Area
index.summary: Scale geometry to a specified area with {x}, {y}, and {z} proportion factors.

index.name: Scale To Length
index.summary: Scale a curve to a specified length with {x}, {y}, and {z} proportion factors.

index.name: Scale To Volume
index.summary: Scale geometry to a specified volume with {x}, {y}, and {z} proportion factors.

index.name: Slide Within Transform
index.summary: Slide within the start and end of a transform to get a transformation state from inside the transform.

index.name: Transform Twisted Box
index.summary: Transform a twisted box (because twisted boxes do not work with regular transform components like Move, Scale, Rotate, etc).

index.name: Tween Consecutive Transforms
index.summary: Tween consecutively between a set of transforms.

index.name: Tween Through Transforms
index.summary: Tween through a set of transforms.

index.name: Tween Two Transforms
index.summary: Tween between two transforms.

index.name: Weighted Average Transform
index.summary: Solve the arithmetic weighted average for a set of transforms.

index.name: Zeroed Transform
index.summary: Outputs a zeroed out transform which represents no transformation or the state before any transforming occured, also known as an identity transform matrix.

index.name: 2Pt Twisted Box
index.summary: Create a twisted box defined by 2 points.

index.name: Average Twisted Box
index.summary: Solve the arithmetic average for a set of twisted boxes.

index.name: Center Twisted Box
index.summary: Create a twisted box centered on a plane.

index.name: Construct Twisted Box
index.summary: Construct a twisted box from a set of 8 corner points.

index.name: Deconstruct Twisted Box
index.summary: Deconstruct a twisted box into sets of its 8 corner points, 12 edge lines, or 6 face polylines.

index.name: Deform Twisted Box
index.summary: Deform a twisted box by moving corner points with motion vectors.

index.name: Domain Twisted Box
index.summary: Create a twisted box defined by a base plane and size domains.

index.name: Evaluate Twisted Box
index.summary: Locate a point inside or on a twisted box, evaluated in normalized {uvw} space.

index.name: Mesh Boolean Twisted Boxes
index.summary: Trim (remove) a set of twisted boxes by a boolean intersection or difference with one or multiple closed meshes
index.description:
Trim (remove) a set of twisted boxes by a boolean intersection or difference with one or multiple closed meshes.
Faster but less accurate than the Boolean Twisted Boxes With Polysurface component.

[Multi-Threaded]

index.name: Mesh Trim Twisted Boxes
index.summary:
Trim (remove) the parts of a twisted box set on one side of a mesh.

[Multi-Threaded]

index.name: Plane Trim Twisted Boxes
index.summary:
Trim (remove) the parts of a twisted box set on one side of a plane.

[Multi-Threaded]

index.name: Polysurface Boolean Twisted Boxes
index.summary: Trim (remove) a set of twisted boxes by a boolean intersection or difference with one or multiple closed polysurfaces(Breps)
index.description:
Trim (remove) a set of twisted boxes by a boolean intersection or difference with one or multiple closed polysurfaces(Breps).

Slower but more accurate than the Boolean Twisted Boxes With Meshes component.

[Multi-Threaded]

index.name: Reference Twisted Box
index.summary: Create a twisted box from a Rhino referenced box like Polysurface (Brep) that has 6 faces and 8 corners
index.description: Create a twisted box from a Rhino referenced box like Polysurface (Brep) that has 6 faces and 8 corners. Best if used with Polysurfaces initially made in Rhino with the 'Box' command and referenced into Grasshopper as it follows that corner vertice order. For other boxes try grasshoppers Twisted Box parameter component or grasshoppers regular Twisted Box component.

index.name: Subdivide Twisted Box
index.summary: Recursively subdivide a twisted box into smaller twisted boxes.

index.name: Surface Trim Twisted Boxes
index.summary:
Trim (remove) the parts of a twisted box set on one side of a surface.

[Multi-Threaded]

index.name: Thicken Twisted Box
index.summary: Thicken a twisted box with layers of twisted boxes from thickness domain dividing parameters.

index.name: Tween Consecutive Twisted Boxes
index.summary: Tween consecutively between a set of twisted boxes.

index.name: Tween Through Twisted Boxes
index.summary: Tween through a set of twisted boxes.

index.name: Tween Two Twisted Boxes
index.summary: Tween between two twisted boxes.

index.name: Twisted Box Array
index.summary: Create a layered array of connected twisted boxes in a box from domain dividing parameters.

index.name: Twisted Box Centers
index.summary: Find the center point (average) of a twisted boxes corner points, edge lines, or face polylines.

index.name: Twisted Box Consecutive Curves
index.summary: Create a layered array of connected twisted boxes consecutively between curves from a thickness and domain dividing parameters.

index.summary: Create a layered array of connected twisted boxes consecutively between a set of meshes from the faces, works on quad and triangle faces. Meshes must have the same topology.

index.name: Twisted Box Consecutive Surfaces
index.summary: Create a layered array of connected twisted boxes consecutively between a set of surfaces from domain dividing parameters.

index.name: Twisted Box Corners
index.summary: Get all 8 corners of a twisted box.

index.name: Twisted Box Curve
index.summary: Create connected twisted boxes along a curve from domain dividing parameters.

index.name: Twisted Box Curve Variable
index.summary: Create connected twisted boxes along a curve from domain dividing parameters, with variable sizes and rotations.

index.name: Twisted Box Extrude
index.summary: Create connected twisted boxes from a profile curve or surface along a vector, curve, or to a point from domain dividing parameters.

index.name: Twisted Box Loft
index.summary: Create twisted boxes between section curves or surfaces

index.name: Twisted Box Mesh
index.summary: Create a layered array of connected twisted boxes on a mesh from the faces and a parameter domain divided thickness, works on quad and triangle faces.

index.name: Twisted Box Pipe
index.summary: Create connected twisted boxes along the inside of a pipe-like surface from domain dividing parameters.

index.summary: Create connected twisted boxes along the inside of a pipe-like surface from a separate set of {u} domain dividing parameters for each {v} parameter.

index.summary: Create connected twisted boxes along two rail curves from domain dividing parameters.

index.summary: Create connected twisted boxes along two rail curves from a separate set of domain dividing parameters for each rail curve.

index.name: Twisted Box Strips
index.summary: Create connected twisted boxes along a set of rail curves from domain dividing parameters.

index.name: Twisted Box Surface
index.summary: Create a layered array of connected twisted boxes on a surface from a thickness and domain dividing parameters.

index.name: Twisted Box Sweep
index.summary: Create connected twisted boxes along four rail curves from domain dividing parameters.

index.name: Twisted Box Sweep Variable
index.summary: Create connected twisted boxes along four rail curves from a separate set of domain dividing parameters for each rail curve.

index.name: Twisted Box Through Curves
index.summary: Create a layered array of connected twisted boxes through a set of curves from a thickness and domain dividing parameters.

index.name: Twisted Box Through Meshes
index.summary: Create a layered array of connected twisted boxes through a set of meshes from the faces, works on quad and triangle faces. Meshes must have the same topology.

index.name: Twisted Box Through Surfaces
index.summary: Create a layered array of connected twisted boxes through a set of surfaces from domain dividing parameters.

index.name: Twisted Box Tube
index.summary: Create a layered tube array of connected twisted boxes along a curve from domain dividing parameters.

index.name: Twisted Box Tube Variable
index.summary: Create a layered tube array of connected twisted boxes along a curve from domain dividing parameters, with variable diameters, thicknesses, and rotations.

index.name: Twisted Box Two Curves
index.summary: Create a layered array of connected twisted boxes between curves from a thickness and domain dividing parameters.

index.name: Twisted Box Two Meshes
index.summary:
Create a layered array of connected twisted boxes between meshes from the faces, works on quad and triangle faces.
Meshes must have the same topology.

index.name: Twisted Box Two Surfaces
index.summary: Create a layered array of connected twisted boxes between surfaces from domain dividing parameters.

index.summary: Solve the arithmetic weighted average for a set of twisted boxes.

CAUTION: This type of export makes the exported data publicly accessible from the viewer. Use the email export component if you want the exported data to be kept private.
The nickname of this component will be shown in the download button of ShapeDiver's viewer, please change it according to your liking.

index.name: Read Shp
index.summary: Use this component to read shapefiles
index.description:
Use this component to read shapefiles.
-
Supported shapefile types are:
1) POINT
2) POLYLINE
3) POLYGON
4) POINTZ (without z values)
5) POLYLINEZ (without z values)
6) POLYGONZ (without z values)
-
Remark: Only WGS84 (EPSG:4326) reference system is supported.
If your shp use another coordinate system you have to reproject it using a GIS software (e.g. QGIS).

index.name: Update File
index.summary: Use this component to update SkinDesigner tools components in an old file
index.description:
Use this component to update SkinDesigner tools components in an old file.
This component doesn't update the installation. It will only update the file
to your current installation. The components that can't be updated automatically
will be marked and should be replaced manually.
-
Provided by SkinDesigner 0.0.65

index.name: Update Skin Designer
index.summary: Code Developers and Beta Testers of new SkinDesigner components can use this component to remove old SkinDesigner components, add new SkinDesigner components, and update existing SkinDesigner components from a synced Github folder on their computer
index.description:
Code Developers and Beta Testers of new SkinDesigner components can use this component to remove old SkinDesigner components, add new SkinDesigner components, and update existing SkinDesigner components from a synced Github folder on their computer.
This component can also update outdated SkinDesigner components in an old Grasshopper file so long as the updates to the components do not involve new inputs or outputs.
-
Provided by SkinDesigner 0.0.65

index.name: Graph.AddEdges
index.summary: Adds the list of Edges to the Graph
index.description: Adds the list of Edges to the Graph. The Vertices of the Edges are merged with existing Vertices if they fall within the input tolerance. No new Edges will be added if they already exist. A zero or null tolerance means that the Vertices of the input Edges will be added to the Graph regardless of their overlap with existing Vertices.

index.name: Graph.AddVertices
index.summary: Adds the list of Vertices to the Graph
index.description: Adds the list of Vertices to the Graph. If a tolerance is specified, the Vertices will be merged with existing Vertices within the input tolerance distance. A zero or null tolerance means that the Vertices will be added to the Graph regardless of their overlap with existing Vertices.

index.summary: Creates a Topology by a list of Vertices and a 2D list of indices of the Vertices in the first argument
index.description: Creates a Topology by a list of Vertices and a 2D list of indices of the Vertices in the first argument. An array of 1 index makes a Vertex. An array of 2 indices makes an Edge. An array of 3 indices either makes a Wire, or, when the array has at least 4 vertices and the first index is the same as the last index, a Face will be created instead. NOTE: This node currently can only create planar Faces.

index.name: Colibri Parameters
index.summary: Collects design parameters (us engineer types would call these 'performance metrics') to chart in Design Explorer
index.description:
Collects design parameters (us engineer types would call these 'performance metrics') to chart in Design Explorer. These will be the vertical axes to the far right on the parallel coordinates plot, next to the design inputs. These values should describe the characteristics of a single design iteration.
You can also combine this output as a static gene in Genome.

index.name: Image Setting
index.summary: Defines how Colibri generates images during flights.  You can specify which viewport[s] to capture, and the resolution of the image.

index.name: Iteration Selection
index.summary: Generates an iteration selection for the Colibri Iterator
index.description:
Generates an iteration selection for the Colibri Iterator. This allows you to iterate over a subset of the design space instead of taking every step along every slider/dropdown/panel.
Use 'Divisions' to define granularity - how many steps to take on any given input.
Use 'Domain' to break the design space up into chunks that can be solved in parallel on different machines.
